Description: One head bead and three glass beads. A head bead of cylindrical form representing a black African in opaque bright-blue glass. The large eyes are formed from circles of white glass with the bright-blue pupils in high relief. The heavy lips are of white glass. The ears are represented, one now missing, by a loop of bright-blue glass; a blob of white below is presumably an earring. A suspension loop on top of the head is in opaque bright-blue glass. Thick brown core. The beads found with the head bead are 'eye-beads' with blue and white 'eyes' on a black ground. Glossy surface.
Curator's comments: See also 1929,1015.629.b, item no.1(faience wedjat-eye). G. Brunton, ‘Mostagedda and the Tasian Culture, London, 1937, pl. LXXXIII and p. 137.
Bibliographic references: Glass / Catalogue of Greek and Roman Glass in the British Museum (408)
Tait 1991 / Five Thousand Years of Glass (pl.46)
